metadata.title: CVE-2020-14155 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
libpcre in PCRE before 8.44 allows an integer overflow via a large numberafter a (?C substring.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14155` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre16-3 - 2:8.39-9ubuntu0.1
libpcre3 - 2:8.39-9ubuntu0.1
libpcre32-3 - 2:8.39-9ubuntu0.1
libpcrecpp0v5 - 2:8.39-9ubuntu0.1
pcregrep - 2:8.39-9ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.39-9ubuntu0.1').
